content: Not sure if this is the right place to be posting but I was curious about reorgs on the beacon chain and wrote up this investigation: https://www.samlewis.me/2022/03/beacon-chain-reorgs/ . One thing that is still puzzling me is why the block in the second reorg I investigated (https://www.samlewis.me/2022/03/beacon-chain-reorgs/#slot-3340347) was reorged. As I describe in the write up, if I understand the fork choice rules, it seems like it shouldn't have been reorged and the network should have included it in the main chain. Anyone have any ideas on what I might be missing?

author: saml0552
content:
It's the delta time from when the previous block was received, which is probably not the most useful way of slicing the data. I went back and computed the time delay between the block arriving to me and the start of the slot for those two blocks..

For 3340346: `slot_time=1646908175000` and `arrival_time=1646908187984` so it arrived 12984ms after the start of the slot.
For 3340347: `slot_time=1646908187000` and `arrival_time=1646908188541` so it arrived 1541ms after the start of the slot.

Still unsure why the network chose 3340346 instead of 3340347, when 3340346 appears (at least to me) to have arrived super late.
